name: Blackburn Rovers FC History Quiz | Blackburn Rovers | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year were Blackburn Rovers formed?
questions.explanation:
1875.

	The club were also founder members of the football league, and finished fourth in the inaugural season of 1888-89.

questions.text: Which ground did Blackburn first play at?
questions.explanation:
Oozehead Ground.

	Between 1875-90, Blackburn played on all of these grounds, before moving to Ewood Park. Only Pleasington Ground remains but as numerous pitches.

questions.text: What year did Blackburn first win the Division One league title?
questions.explanation:
1912.

	Rovers won the title twice in the 20th century, in seasons 1911-12, and 1913-14.

Tom Mitchell.

	Tom Mitchell managed the club between 1884-86.

questions.text: How many times in the 19th century did Blackburn win the FA Cup?
questions.explanation:
5.

	They first won the cup in 1884 with a 2-1 victory over Queens Park, followed by 2-0 a year later against the same team, and for a third time in a row by beating West Bromwich Albion 2-0, after a replay in 1886. In 1890, they beat Sheffield Wednesday 6-1 in the final, followed by a 3-1 win against Notts County in 1891. They only won the cup once in the 20th century, by beating Huddersfield Town 2-1 in 1928.

questions.text: Which of these scored the most league goals for the club?
questions.explanation:
Simon Garner.

	Garner scored 168 league goals in 484 games for the club between 1978-92. He would often be seen walking his dog in the park the day after scoring a goal!

questions.text: What was the name of the benefactor who made Blackburn Rovers a Premiership force?
questions.explanation:
Jack Walker.

	Walker was a former steel mill owner in the town, and lifelong fan of the club, who sold his business for a large sum of money, and ploughed millions into the rebuilding of Ewood Park and the club. 'Uncle Jack' as he was affectionately known by the fans, died in 2000, and the club had a statue of him erected outside the ground.

questions.text: In what season did Blackburn first win the Premiership title?
questions.explanation:
1994-95.

	Although Blackburn lost to Liverpool 2-1 at Anfield on the final day of the season, Manchester United couldn't beat West Ham United at Upton Park, which gave Blackburn the title.

questions.text: Which of these scored the most goals in one season for the club?
questions.explanation:
Ted Harper.

	Ted Harper scored 42 goals in the 1925/26 season, but Blackburn could only finish 12th in the league.

questions.text: Who was Blackburn playing when they were relegated from the Premiership in the 1998/99 season?
questions.explanation:
Manchester United.

	May 12, 1999, was the date that all Blackburn fans would rather forget, as they played out a 0-0 draw with United, and were relegated into Division One. Two years later, they were back in the Premiership, finishing second in the 1st division, promoted alongside champions Fulham, and play-off winners, Bolton Wanderers.
